thread.title: Va. park a star, anti-light pollution group proclaims
thread.title_full: Va. park a star, anti-light pollution group proclaims

title: Va. park a star, anti-light pollution group proclaims
text:
Va. park a star, anti-light pollution group proclaims Associated Press | 
SCOTTSBURG — A Virginia park that is a star-gazer’s haven has been named an International Dark Sky Park. 
The designation for Staunton River State Park in Scottsburg recognizes the park’s outdoor lighting policy, which is intended to minimize light pollution, making the park a welcome dark place on the densely populated East Coast. ADVERTISEMENT 
The recognition is from the International Dark Sky Association, which advocates for the protection of night skies. 
The Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation says the state park is the first in Virginia to be recognized by the association. 
A stargazing event will be held at the park’s visitor center Aug. 21 from 9 to 11 p.m. Join astronomers on the field for an opportunity to gaze at celestial bodies through high-powered telescopes. 
Staunton River State Park also promotes a star party each year. This year’s star party will be held Oct. 12-18. For information, visit www.stauntonriver-starparty.org .
